events.name: Hackerspace Talk: Sentiment Analysis in Finance at Bloomberg
events.description:
Talk Description:
In this talk, Gary will give a short introduction to machine learning and its applications in natural language processing, followed by a discussion of a difficult computational linguistics problem: sentiment analysis of financial news. Various approaches to this problem, including current state of the art methods, will be discussed. Practical issues, such as training data creation, feature selection, and error analysis, will also be discussed. A Q&A session is included.

Speaker Profile
Gary Kazantsev runs the R&D Machine Learning group at Bloomberg, leading projects at the intersection of computational linguistics, machine learning and finance such as sentiment analysis of financial news, market impact indicators, question answering, social media analytics, recommendation systems and predictive modeling of financial markets. He holds degrees in Physics, Mathematics and Computer Science from Boston University.

Disclaimer: this talk is technical, and it is expected that all attendees have some prior, introductory knowledge to Machine Learning.
